job.title: Laborant/in Process Technology
job.plaincontent:
Laborant/in Process Technology - (18019945)
Description
Syngenta zählt zu den führenden Unternehmen der Agrarbranche. Mehr als 28.000 Mitarbeiter arbeiten in über 90 Ländern weltweit daran, das Ertragspotenzial von Kulturpflanzen ständig zu verbessern. Durch erstklassige Forschung, unsere globale Präsenz und die enge Zusammenarbeit mit unseren Kunden helfen wir, die Ernteerträge und die landwirtschaftliche Produktivität zu steigern. Wir tragen dazu bei, die Umwelt zu schützen sowie die Gesundheit und Lebensqualität zu verbessern.
Für unsere neuen Standort in Muttenz (BL) suchen wir per sofort oder nach Vereinbarung eine/n Laborant/in Process Technology (m/f/n). Das Werk befindet sich im Infrapark Baselland in Muttenz. Die Nähe des Werks zu unserem Technischen Entwicklungszentrum in Münchwilen wird den Schritt von der Pilotanlage zur Produktion erleichtern.
Laborant/in Process Technology (m/f/n)
Zweck und Umfang der Stelle
- Beitrag zu innovativen Prozess Technologie Lösungen für neue Wirkstoffe - Selbständige Planung und Bearbeitung chemischer Synthesen und Aufarbeitungsverfahren wie Kristallisation, Destillation und Extraktion. - Weitgehend selbständige Optimierung von Pilot- und Produktionsverfahren unter Berücksichtigung ökonomischer, ökologischer und prozesssicherheitstechnischer Aspekte - Generieren wichtiger Prozessdaten (z.B. Reaktions-/Umsatzkontrolle, Prozesssicherheit, Qualität der Rohstoffe und Produkte) - Aktive Mitwirkung bei der Vorbereitung und Überwachung von Rohmaterialtests und Betriebseinführungen
Verantwortung der Stelle
- Hat Vorbildfunktion bei der Einhaltung der Vorschriften (GSU/HSE: Laborregeln, Richtlinien und Wegleitungen) und sorgt für Sicherheit, Sauberkeit und Ordnung im Labor. Meldet allfällige Missstände und ergreift selbständig Massnahmen zur Vermeidung und Behebung von Missständen. - Selbständige Gestaltung und Inbetriebnahmen von Versuchsanlagen. - Detaillierte und nachvollziehbare Protokollierung der Arbeitsergebnisse und der gemachten Beobachtungen in Versuchsprotokollen mit Angaben zum Versuchszweck. - Ist bestrebt die zur Verfügung stehenden Ressourcen effizient zu nutzen und zeigt sich verantwortlich für den sorgfältigen Umgang mit Laborausrüstung und Laborgeräten bzw. für deren Unterhalt. Macht den Vorgesetzten auf allfällige Engpässe bzw. Freikapazitäten rechtzeitig aufmerksam. - Führt gemäss allgemeinen Zielvorgaben einfache bis komplexe Experimente unter Verwendung von Standard- als auch Spezial-Laborausrüstung selbständig durch.
Qualifications
- Laborant Fachrichtung Synthese oder BSc in Chemie - mind. 5 Jahre Berufserfahrung. -
- sehr gute Kenntnisse im sicheren Umgang mit Chemikalien und sauberes Arbeiten im Labor - sehr gute manuelle Fähigkeiten und Kenntnisse im Umgang mit Labor Standardausrüstung und Standard Analysengeräten (GC, HPLC, NMR) - sehr gute Kenntnisse der Synthetischen Chemie, Trennverfahren (Destillation, Kristallisation, Extraktion, Chromatographie) und analytischer Methoden (DC, GC, HPLC und NMR)
- Gute mündliche und schriftliche Deutschkentniss. Gute Englichkentniss sind ein Plus. - Gute Kenntnisse in standard EDV-Applikationen (Office, ELN, Mat Ref und Starlims) und Interesse an Laborautomatisations-Sofware (HitecZang, Labview, Systag) - Ist gut organisiert und plant die Arbeit entsprechend den Ziel- und Terminvorgaben.
Was wir bieten:
- Mit Ihrer Arbeit können Sie einen wichtigen Betrag zur Ernährungssicherheit der Menschen leisten -> #bringingplantpontentialtolife - Eine verantwortungsvolle Aufgabe mit interessanten Herausforderungen - Ein offenes und angenehmes Arbeitsklima - Enge Zusammenarbeit mit der Entwicklung und der Produktion
Sind Sie interessiert? Dann bewerben Sie sich Online. Wir freuen uns auf Ihre Bewerbung!
Syngenta ist ein Arbeitgeber für Chancengleichheit und diskriminiert nicht bei der Einstellung, Einstellung, Ausbildung, Beförderung oder anderen Beschäftigungspraktiken aus Gründen der Rasse, der Hautfarbe, der Religion, des Geschlechts, der nationalen Herkunft, des Alters, der sexuellen Orientierung, des Familienstandes oder des Veteranenstatus, der Behinderung oder jeder andere gesetzlich geschützte Status.
Primary Location
: CHE-Muttenz-Muttenz
Job
: P&S - Production

Laborant/in Process Technology - (18019945) 

Description

 

Syngentazählt zu den führenden Unternehmen der Agrarbranche. Mehr als 28.000 Mitarbeiter arbeiten in über 90 Ländern weltweit daran, das Ertragspotenzial von Kulturpflanzen ständig zu verbessern. Durch erstklassige Forschung, unsere globale Präsenz und die enge Zusammenarbeit mit unseren Kunden helfen wir, die Ernteerträge und die landwirtschaftliche Produktivität zu steigern. Wir tragen dazu bei, die Umwelt zu schützen sowie die Gesundheit und Lebensqualität zu verbessern.

Für unsere neuen Standort in Muttenz (BL) suchen wir per sofort oder nach Vereinbarung eine/n Laborant/in Process Technology (m/f/n). Das Werk befindet sich im Infrapark Baselland in Muttenz. Die Nähe des Werks zu unserem Technischen Entwicklungszentrum in Münchwilen wird den Schritt von der Pilotanlage zur Produktion erleichtern.

Laborant/in Process Technology (m/f/n)

  Zweck und Umfang der Stelle
  • Beitrag zu innovativen Prozess Technologie Lösungen für neue Wirkstoffe
  • Selbständige Planung und Bearbeitung chemischer Synthesen und Aufarbeitungsverfahren wie Kristallisation, Destillation und Extraktion.
  • Weitgehend selbständige Optimierung von Pilot- und Produktionsverfahren unter Berücksichtigung ökonomischer, ökologischer und prozesssicherheitstechnischer Aspekte
  • Generieren wichtiger Prozessdaten (z.B. Reaktions-/Umsatzkontrolle, Prozesssicherheit, Qualität der Rohstoffe und Produkte)
  • Aktive Mitwirkung bei der Vorbereitung und Überwachung von Rohmaterialtests und Betriebseinführungen
  Verantwortung der Stelle  
  • Hat Vorbildfunktion bei der Einhaltung der Vorschriften (GSU/HSE: Laborregeln, Richtlinien und Wegleitungen) und sorgt für Sicherheit, Sauberkeit und Ordnung im Labor. Meldet allfällige Missstände und ergreift selbständig Massnahmen zur Vermeidung und Behebung von Missständen.
  • Selbständige Gestaltung und Inbetriebnahmen von Versuchsanlagen.
  • Detaillierte und nachvollziehbare Protokollierung der Arbeitsergebnisse und der gemachten Beobachtungen in Versuchsprotokollen mit Angaben zum Versuchszweck.
  • Ist bestrebt die zur Verfügung stehenden Ressourcen effizient zu nutzen und zeigt sich verantwortlich für den sorgfältigen Umgang mit Laborausrüstung und Laborgeräten bzw. für deren Unterhalt. Macht den Vorgesetzten auf allfällige Engpässe bzw. Freikapazitäten rechtzeitig aufmerksam.
  • Führt gemäss allgemeinen Zielvorgaben einfache bis komplexe Experimente unter Verwendung von Standard- als auch Spezial-Laborausrüstung selbständig durch. 
 

Qualifications

  
  • Laborant Fachrichtung Synthese oder BSc in Chemie
  • mind. 5 Jahre Berufserfahrung.
    • sehr gute Kenntnisse im sicheren Umgang mit Chemikalien und sauberes Arbeiten im Labor
    • sehr gute manuelle Fähigkeiten und Kenntnisse im Umgang mit Labor Standardausrüstung und Standard Analysengeräten (GC, HPLC, NMR)
    • sehr gute Kenntnisse der Synthetischen Chemie, Trennverfahren (Destillation, Kristallisation, Extraktion, Chromatographie) und analytischer Methoden (DC, GC, HPLC und NMR)
  • Gute mündliche und schriftliche Deutschkentniss. Gute Englichkentniss sind ein Plus.
  • Gute Kenntnisse in standard EDV-Applikationen (Office, ELN, Mat Ref und Starlims) und Interesse an Laborautomatisations-Sofware (HitecZang, Labview, Systag)
  • Ist gut organisiert und plant die Arbeit entsprechend den Ziel- und Terminvorgaben.
  Was wir bieten:
  • Mit Ihrer Arbeit können Sie einen wichtigen Betrag zur Ernährungssicherheit der Menschen leisten -> #bringingplantpontentialtolife
  • Eine verantwortungsvolle Aufgabe mit interessanten Herausforderungen
  • Ein offenes und angenehmes Arbeitsklima
  • Enge Zusammenarbeit mit der Entwicklung und der Produktion
 

Sind Sie interessiert? Dann bewerben Sie sich Online. Wir freuen uns auf Ihre Bewerbung!

Syngenta ist ein Arbeitgeber für Chancengleichheit und diskriminiert nicht bei der Einstellung, Einstellung, Ausbildung, Beförderung oder anderen Beschäftigungspraktiken aus Gründen der Rasse, der Hautfarbe, der Religion, des Geschlechts, der nationalen Herkunft, des Alters, der sexuellen Orientierung, des Familienstandes oder des Veteranenstatus, der Behinderung oder jeder andere gesetzlich geschützte Status.

job.title: Corporate Insurance Manager
job.plaincontent:
Corporate Insurance Manager - (18019891)
Description
Syngenta is a leading science-based agtech company; dedicated to bringing plant potential to life. Each of our 28,000 employees in more than 90 countries work together to solve one of humanity’s most pressing challenges: growing more food with fewer resources. A diverse workforce and an inclusive workplace environment are enablers of our ambition to be the most collaborative and trusted team in agriculture. Our employees reflect the diversity of our customers, the markets where we operate and the communities which we serve. We invite you to help us shape the future of agriculture. At Syngenta, we believe every employee has a role to play in safely feeding the world and taking care of our planet. We are currently looking for a Corporate Insurance Manager to join our team in Basel. In this role you will:
- Support international insurance program implementation, controlling of premium payment, claims payment etc. - Conduct internal controls and oversee governance within the insurance area and Syngenta Rückversicherung AG (Reinsurance) - Act as risk management and compliance officer for the reinsurance captive Syngenta Rückversicherung AG (Reinsurance) - Act as system administrator/manager of the Corporate Insurance Management System, CIMS - Act as a key member of the corporate insurance function within Legal responsible for group-wide implementation and compliance of the corporate insurance/risk management strategy - Support monthly financial reporting as well as Annual Financial Statement
Accountabilities
- Conduct periodic risk management cycles for Syngenta Rückversicherung AG - Assure observation of compliance within the insurance governance framework and internal control processes - Report on risk management, internal controls and compliance to the General Manager and the Board of Syngenta Rückversicherung AG - Oversee the implementation of global insurance programs: monitor and track policies, track insurance premium payment flow - Capture insurance policies, insurance transactions and claims data and payments in the Corpo-rate Insurance Management System (CIMS) - Assure data quality, security and consistency in the CIMS - Support operational insurance and regulatory compliance processes including observation of regulatory changes, accounting support, accounts payables and receivables process support - Support of insurance procurement processes for collection of data relevant for the insurance renewal processes - Provide service to internal and external stakeholders - Oversee monthly financial reporting and support with Annual Financial Statement inputs - Assist with budget planning processes
Qualifications
Critical knowledge and experience
- 5-10 years of administration experience in the insurance or re-insurance industry or within a captive and/or from an accounting or financial function - Fundamental knowledge of global insurance programs including basic knowledge of business related insurances - Knowledge about administration of captive insurance companies and the regulatory requirements under FINMA - Internal control processes, compliance and financial reporting - Good analytical skills - Ability to understand numbers - Basic understanding of financial accounting principles - Basic understanding of risk assessment methodologies
Critical technical, professional and personal capabilities
- Ability to navigate a matrix organisation & build relationships across - Good communication skills and ability to engage various stakeholders - Agility to balance pragmatism and in-depth analysis on case-by-case - High degree of resilience - Focus on prioritization, simplicity/practicality - Fluency in English and German (writing and speaking) - Ability to identify and execute tasks independently
We offer a variety of financial and none-financial benefits including:
- Annual bonuses - A competitive pension fund plan - Preferential conditions with insurance companies - On campus health and fitness services - Family-friendly initiatives - Exclusive reduction offers for employees
We look forward for to your application. Syngenta is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate in recruitment, hiring, training, promotion or any other employment practices for reasons of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, marital or veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected status
Primary Location
: CHE-Basel-Basel
Job
: Legal - Intellectual Property

job.title: Head of Digital Science Technology
job.plaincontent:
Head of Digital Science Technology - (18020138)
Description
Syngenta is a leading science-based agtech company; dedicated to bringing plant potential to life. Each of our 28,000 employees in more than 90 countries work together to solve one of humanity’s most pressing challenges: growing more food with fewer resources. A diverse workforce and an inclusive workplace environment are enablers of our ambition to be the most collaborative and trusted team in agriculture. Our employees reflect the diversity of our customers, the markets where we operate and the communities which we serve. Through leading innovations, we help farmers around the world meet the challenge of feeding a growing population and taking care of our planet. Our Crop Protection (CP) Research & Development team is currently seeking a Head of Digital Science Technology . In this new role you will:
- Develop and deliver a vision and strategy for digital science technologies in CP R&D, including opportunities, investments and collaborations to enable scientists to bring business value - Ensure that opportunities to use digital science to capture value from R&D data are fully explored and delivered, bringing return on investment and supporting scientists to be more effective with digital science and technologies - Be responsible for leading the people and activities of the Digital Science Technology team within the CP R&D Technology & Digital Integration organization - Our expected outcome is that R&D is better connected to digital business opportunities across the breadth of Syngenta
Accountabilities
- Define how R&D creates additional business value through technologies to support digital science and utilization of data assets and analytics - Responsible for the creation of new digital science capabilities for the business by envisioning and executing strategies that will improve business performance by enabling informed decision making - Work with R&D functions, R&D IT and Seeds R&D in order to provide advanced data analytics and modelling systems. - Leads and prioritises activities of the Digital Science Technology team (i.e. Digital Science Identification & Evaluation Lead, Data Exploitation Lead, Data Modelling and Analytics Experts) ensuring proper execution of deliverables aligned with the overall R&D digital vision and strategies - Through the team, develops innovative and relevant analytical models utilizing contemporary and traditional data mining and analytical techniques, applied to structured and unstructured data sets - Drive promotion / education of data science throughout R&D by communicating the vision and use cases for advanced analytics - Works in close collaboration with R&D functions, RDIT, data and analytics teams in creating big data applications through the utilization of structured and unstructured data, designing optimal data architecture, and experimenting on new machine learning techniques - Maintain awareness of digital trends and dynamics, take initiative and conduct exploratory data analyses and experimental designs
Qualifications
Critical knowledge
- A strong academic foundation in digital or natural sciences to post-graduate level - Broad and deep understanding of the use of digital science and exploitation of data in AgTech industries or adjacent industries - A good understanding of R&D processes, science and technology in industry - Basic knowledge of CP technologies including chemistry, bioscience, biological targets, etc.
Critical experience
- Experience in working between R&D and IT organizations to be able to match digital science opportunities to the context of R&D innovation - Experience of R&D processes in Natural Science industries - Experience of developing a technology vision and delivering it through to implementation - Experience in leading, motivating and setting direction for a team
Critical technical, professional and personal capabilities
- Strategic mindset – can see through complexity and find simple ways to bring value - Develops and promotes a vision, and is able to translate it to strategic and operational delivery - Curious and well-connected outside the company to understand a rapidly changing technology landscape - Well connected to CP strategy and R&D priorities of CPLT and R&D leadership teams and functions - Able to connect outside R&D to functions and projects that use or contribute data in/out of R&D to bring business value - Close and collaborative working with RDIT to align with the global Syngenta data strategy, synergise efforts and focus on where we can bring value
We offer a unique opportunity to work in the digital science transformation and innovation space and facing the challenges of sustainable food supply. We look forward for to your application. Syngenta is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate in recruitment, hiring, training, promotion or any other employment practices for reasons of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, marital or veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected status
Primary Location
: CHE-Basel-Basel
Other Locations
: GBR-Berkshire-Bracknell
Job
: R&D - Other
job.htmlcontent:
Head of Digital Science Technology - (18020138) 

Description

  Syngenta is a leading science-based agtech company; dedicated to bringing plant potential to life. Each of our 28,000 employees in more than 90 countries work together to solve one of humanity’s most pressing challenges: growing more food with fewer resources. A diverse workforce and an inclusive workplace environment are enablers of our ambition to be the most collaborative and trusted team in agriculture.
Our employees reflect the diversity of our customers, the markets where we operate and the communities which we serve. Through leading innovations, we help farmers around the world meet the challenge of feeding a growing population and taking care of our planet.
Our Crop Protection (CP) Research & Development team is currently seeking a Head of Digital Science Technology. In this new role you will: 
  • Develop and deliver a vision and strategy for digital science technologies in CP R&D, including opportunities, investments and collaborations to enable scientists to bring business value 
  • Ensure that opportunities to use digital science to capture value from R&D data are fully explored and delivered, bringing return on investment and supporting scientists to be more effective with digital science and technologies 
  • Be responsible for leading the people and activities of the Digital Science Technology team within the CP R&D Technology & Digital Integration organization 
  • Our expected outcome is that R&D is better connected to digital business opportunities across the breadth of Syngenta
Accountabilities 
  • Define how R&D creates additional business value through technologies to support digital science and utilization of data assets and analytics 
  • Responsible for the creation of new digital science capabilities for the business by envisioning and executing strategies that will improve business performance by enabling informed decision making
  • Work with R&D functions, R&D IT and Seeds R&D in order to provide advanced data analytics and modelling systems.
  • Leads and prioritises activities of the Digital Science Technology team (i.e. Digital Science Identification & Evaluation Lead,  Data Exploitation Lead, Data Modelling and Analytics Experts) ensuring proper execution of deliverables aligned with the overall R&D digital vision and strategies
  • Through the team, develops innovative and relevant analytical models utilizing contemporary and traditional data mining and analytical techniques, applied to structured and unstructured data sets
  • Drive promotion / education of data science throughout R&D by communicating the vision and use cases for advanced analytics
  • Works in close collaboration with R&D functions, RDIT, data and analytics teams in creating big data applications through the utilization of structured and unstructured data, designing optimal data architecture, and experimenting on new machine learning techniques
  • Maintain awareness of digital trends and dynamics, take initiative and conduct exploratory data analyses and experimental designs
 

Qualifications

  Critical knowledge 
  • A strong academic foundation in digital or natural sciences to post-graduate level
  • Broad and deep understanding of the use of digital science and exploitation of data in AgTech industries or adjacent industries
  • A good understanding of R&D processes, science and technology in industry
  • Basic knowledge of CP technologies including chemistry, bioscience, biological targets, etc.
Critical experience
  • Experience in working between R&D and IT organizations to be able to match digital science opportunities to the context of R&D innovation
  • Experience of R&D processes in Natural Science industries
  • Experience of developing a technology vision and delivering it through to implementation
  • Experience in leading, motivating and setting direction for a team
Critical technical, professional and personal capabilities
  • Strategic mindset – can see through complexity and find simple ways to bring value
  • Develops and promotes a vision, and is able to translate it to strategic and operational delivery
  • Curious and well-connected outside the company to understand a rapidly changing technology landscape
  • Well connected to CP strategy and R&D priorities of CPLT and R&D leadership teams and functions
  • Able to connect outside R&D to functions and projects that use or contribute data in/out of R&D to bring business value
  • Close and collaborative working with RDIT to align with the global Syngenta data strategy, synergise efforts and focus on where we can bring value
We offer a unique opportunity to work in the digital science transformation and innovation space and facing the challenges of sustainable food supply.  We look forward for to your application.
Syngenta is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate in recruitment, hiring, training, promotion or any other employment practices for reasons of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, marital or veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected status

: CHE-Basel-Basel

job.title: Head Data Strategy & Management
job.plaincontent:
Head Data Strategy & Management - (18020137)
Description
Syngenta is a leading science-based agtech company; dedicated to bringing plant potential to life. Each of our 28,000 employees in more than 90 countries work together to solve one of humanity’s most pressing challenges: growing more food with fewer resources. A diverse workforce and an inclusive workplace environment are enablers of our ambition to be the most collaborative and trusted team in agriculture. Our employees reflect the diversity of our customers, the markets where we operate and the communities which we serve. Through leading innovations, we help farmers around the world meet the challenge of feeding a growing population and taking care of our planet. Our Crop Protection Research & Development team is currently seeking a Head of Data Strategy & Management . In this new role you will:
- Have global responsibility to establish and optimize the R&D Data Strategy, guidelines and quality standards to support R&D processes and projects - Be responsible for a consistent approach to data stewardship and governance, working with leaders, scientists and data managers in R&D Functions and Regions - Lead a team of Data Owners and Data Managers to ensure scientists can exploit R&D data assets easily and effectively for projects and business delivery
Accountabilities
- Develops the data strategy, guidelines and quality standards to enable R&D to function efficiently and effectively within the broader context of Syngenta Group - Creates and supports effective data stewardship and governance together with R&D Functions and RDIT, and ensures data are regulated and protected to GDPR guidelines - Leads the data governance process including relevant data stewardship group(s) - Looks at the bigger picture of data generation, management, utilization and stewardship and how this can be optimized to deliver business outcomes and enable decision-making and pipeline delivery through the whole R&D system - Identifies opportunities for R&D innovation to be done better or more efficiently through more effective use of data, and works with the relevant Functions to implement new approaches - Identifies strategic bottlenecks that could be resolved through a different approach to data generation, utilization, management or stewardship - Brings an external view of best practice from competitors and other industries - Leads a team of Data Owners and Data Managers to deliver the data governance program
Qualifications
Critical knowledge
- Graduate or Postgraduate qualification in data-related subject matter, ideally in natural sciences - A deep understanding of data management and governance principles and practice - Understands how data are created and used by scientists, and the value of data to the enterprise - Enough subject matter expertise to know what to challenge in chemistry and biological R&D - Broad knowledge of IT tools and technologies relating to data management and governance
Critical experience
- >5 years’ experience in leading data management in a complex R&D environment - Experienced in strategic leadership and operational delivery of strategic priorities - Experience of working effectively in a culturally diverse international matrix of stakeholders - Experience in understanding complex stakeholder needs, and finding good outcomes - Experience in negotiation to obtain the best outcome for the business
Critical technical, professional and personal capabilities
- Personal skill as a challenger, versus governor - Diligence, to do it right - Able to adapt and adjust in the face of changing business need - Ability to gain trust, influence and steer a wide range of stakeholders - Visionary – able to envisage future uses of data - Excellent communicator to non-technical stakeholders
We offer a unique opportunity to work in the digital science transformation and innovation space and facing the challenges of sustainable food supply. We look forward for to your application . Syngenta is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate in recruitment, hiring, training, promotion or any other employment practices for reasons of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, marital or veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected status
Primary Location
: CHE-Basel-Basel
Other Locations
: GBR-Berkshire-Bracknell
Job
: R&D - Other

  • Leads the data governance process including relevant data stewardship group(s)
  • Looks at the bigger picture of data generation, management, utilization and stewardship and how this can be optimized to deliver business outcomes and enable decision-making and pipeline delivery through the whole R&D system
  • Identifies opportunities for R&D innovation to be done better or more efficiently through more effective use of data, and works with the relevant Functions to implement new approaches
  • Identifies strategic bottlenecks that could be resolved through a different approach to data generation, utilization, management or stewardship
  • Brings an external view of best practice from competitors and other industries
  • Leads a team of Data Owners and Data Managers to deliver the data governance program
 

Qualifications

  Critical knowledge 
  • Graduate or Postgraduate qualification in data-related subject matter, ideally in natural sciences
  • A deep understanding of data management and governance principles and practice
  • Understands how data are created and used by scientists, and the value of data to the enterprise
  • Enough subject matter expertise to know what to challenge in chemistry and biological R&D
  • Broad knowledge of IT tools and technologies relating to data management and governance
Critical experience
  • >5 years’ experience in leading data management in a complex R&D environment
  • Experienced in strategic leadership and operational delivery of strategic priorities
  • Experience of working effectively in a culturally diverse international matrix of stakeholders
  • Experience in understanding complex stakeholder needs, and finding good outcomes
  • Experience in negotiation to obtain the best outcome for the business
Critical technical, professional and personal capabilities
  • Personal skill as a challenger, versus governor
  • Diligence, to do it right
  • Able to adapt and adjust in the face of changing business need
  • Ability to gain trust, influence and steer a wide range of stakeholders
  • Visionary – able to envisage future uses of data
  • Excellent communicator to non-technical stakeholders
We offer a unique opportunity to work in the digital science transformation and innovation space and facing the challenges of sustainable food supply. We look forward for to your application.
Syngenta is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate in recruitment, hiring, training, promotion or any other employment practices for reasons of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, marital or veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected status

job.title: Analytical Development Lab Technician
job.plaincontent:
Analytical Development Lab Technician - (18020353)
Description
Syngenta Monthey est un site de production de substances actives, fort de 900 collaborateurs. Ses activités sont principalement liées à la protection des plantes et dans une moindre mesure au secteur Produits professionnels.
Nous recrutons un / uneAnalytical Development Lab Technician afin d’étoffer notre équipe dynamique au sein du laboratoire de développement analytique. Nous sommes à la recherche d’une personne motivée qui sait travailler en équipe.
Responsabilités :
- Effectuer les analyses spéciales / complexes de manière autonome en respectant les méthodes officielles tout en gardant un œil critique lors de l’interprétation des résultats analytiques - Développement de nouvelles méthodes analytiques - Maitriser et utiliser tous les appareillages spécifiques selon organisation du laboratoire - Garantir la fiabilité des résultats et reporter systématiquement les problèmes rencontrés lors des analyses tout en assurant un reporting complet et détaillé - Assurer la connaissance des risques HSEQ et respecter les règles HSEQ liées à l’activité.
Qualifications
Qualifications et compétences techniques :
- CFC de technicien de laboratoire en chimie ou équivalent - Minimum 5 années d’expérience - Connaissances approfondies des techniques de laboratoire (GC, HPLC, titration…) avec plusieurs années d’expérience - Maitrise du développement analytique GC et HPLC - Capacité à travailler de manière autonome pour délivrer les résultats nécessaires - Analyse d’un grand nombre de données. Interprétation de résultats complexes - Être capable de travailler en gérant les éléments d’incertitude - Gestion de plusieurs projets / analyses en même temps - Travail en collaboration avec les membres de son team et les différents partenaires - Connaissances théoriques et/ou pratiques en spectroscopie de masse, chromatographie ionique et analyse élémentaire sont un plus
Avantages Offerts Aux Collaborateurs Syngenta :
- 40h/ semaine de travail avec flextime et jours de cumul - Fond de pension privé Syngenta - Bonus basé sur la performance individuelle et l'atteinte d'objectifs de Syngenta - Campus Syngenta : Restaurant d’entreprise, parking gratuit
Syngenta s'engage pour la Diversité. Nous encourageons toutes les candidatures indépendamment de l'origine sociale et culturelle, de l'âge, du genre, du handicap, de l'orientation sexuelle ou des croyances religieuses.

job.title: Commercial Data Analyst
job.plaincontent:
Commercial Data Analyst - (18019940)
Description
Syngenta is a leading science-based agtech company; dedicated to bringing plant potential to life. Each of our 28,000 employees in more than 90 countries work together to solve one of humanity’s most pressing challenges: growing more food with fewer resources. A diverse workforce and an inclusive workplace environment are enablers of our ambition to be the most collaborative and trusted team in agriculture. Our employees reflect the diversity of our customers, the markets where we operate and the communities which we serve. We invite you to help us shape the future of agriculture. At Syngenta, we believe every employee has a role to play in safely feeding the world and taking care of our planet. The Commercial Excellence team is currently seeking a Commercial Data Analyst . In this role you will:
- Be responsible for handling data analysis opportunities to support the commercial function - Ensure that Data quality and business insights generated from the data comply with business rules defined by commercial stakeholders - Provide accurate and concise results with recommendations to management. Synthesize data across functions/departments - Be the connection between the commercial function and the internal data scientist team - Support the commercial function to enhance analytics capabilities and to understand the value of a data analyst:
- Review existing global analytics libraries and propose scaling approach, structure and tools - View on basic and advanced sales analytics: Further scale and develop analytics to unlock potential of our sales team with the help of SFDC in selected markets - View on basic and advanced product analytics: Look at the existing analytics and propose use of data enhancements to the global PPD (post patent defense) and NPI (new product introduction) process
- Support global “track and trace” program as analytics lead for commercial related use cases
Accountabilities
- 80% data diagnostic and analysis, 20% data strategy - Performing detailed analysis of data availability and corresponding ability/limitations to analytics - Data Cleaning, data integration & Installing and configuring the analytics components of the solution - Developing predictive models based on business requirements - Validating model performance and presenting model results to business - Train business teams to use the analytics solution - Support business teams through the model life cycle onsite and remotely - Work closely with the business team to understand the analytics usage based on current data
Qualifications
Critical knowledge and education
- Degree in natural or life science, or math-related (statistics), Engineering, Computer Science - Certification in Analytics - Tableau, Qlik Sense, Spotfire, Python and R - Awareness of Customer Life cycle and Sales funnel process
Critical experience
- Min. 4 years’ experience in commercial related roles - Min 2 years’ day to day operational experience with Salesforce.com - Min 2. years’ experience of data analysis, modeling, statistics, reporting and analytics - Working experience on R and Python; in depth knowledge of various statistical techniques and other BI and Visualization tools QlikView, Tableau - Hands on experience in Mathematical /Statistical Modeling - Experience working with real-world large-scale, high dimensional data sets
Critical technical, professional and personal capabilities
- Demonstrated ability to work both independently and within a team environment - Team player and collaborative behavior - Communicates with impact - Focuses on customers
We offer a variety of financial and none-financial benefits including:
- Annual bonuses - A competitive pension fund plan - Preferential conditions with insurance companies - On campus health and fitness services - Family-friendly initiatives - Exclusive reduction offers for employees
We look forward for to your application. Syngenta is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate in recruitment, hiring, training, promotion or any other employment practices for reasons of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, marital or veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected status

job.title: Technical Lead
job.plaincontent:
Technical Lead - (18020122)
Description
Syngenta is a leading science based AgTech company. Our 40,000 employees in more than 90 countries work together to solve one of humanity’s most pressing challenges: growing more food, in a sustainable way, with fewer resources to feed a growing population.
To enable this, we are looking for an experienced senior level developer with a background in software engineering, agile methodology and operational ready products (DevOps) to join our Data Platform team as a Technical Lead .
In this role you will be responsible for improvement of data platforms (design, architecture and deployment of critical features) and providing knowledge on efficient development practices, with proficiency in full-stack development.
The Data Platform team is accountable for delivering enterprise shared services that are used to ingest, store, transform and expose external raw or internally transformed structured and unstructured datasets which enable analytics insights and empower digital solutions for the benefit of end-users (growers and research and development group).
Key success factors for the role are:
- working with agile product development teams with a distributed team environment (internal and external, Pune/India and US) - effective stakeholder management and interaction with data platform managers, users (agronomists, data scientists, data engineers) and IT supporting teams.
Qualifications
- Bachelor or MSc degree plus 8+ years’ relevant software engineering working experience - Explicit and extensive agile delivery experience - Very strong understanding of structured and unstructured data - Very strong understanding of cloud architectures, ideally AWS - Very strong understanding of object-oriented programming languages like Scala or Java - Very strong understanding of SQL database (such as mySQL) and one noSQL database (such as MongoDB, Neo4J, elasticsearch or cassandra) - Good understanding with container orchestration tools (such as dockers) - Very strong understanding of designing RESTful APIs - Good understanding of Full-Stack development - Good understanding of Micro-service architectures, design patterns and distributed architectures - Good understanding of Unix commands and scripting - Good understanding of automation and CI/CD (test and build automation) - Familiarity with GitHub and Gitlab - Exposure in machine learning and advanced analytics is a strong plus - Exposure with image management is a strong plus - Exposure with heterogenous research data is a strong plus - Exposure in agriculture and biology is a plus
Skills:
- Ability to transform business requirement into expected data platform outcome - Ability to prioritize development efforts and to deliver in alignment with the strategy and with a long-term mindset - Abilityto work in a matrix/complex environment and to orchestratemultiple IT capabilities through project/program management methodologies such as PMP, Agile - Excellence in network building and stakeholder management at all levels of the organization through effective communication and influencing skills; including theability to explain technical information to individuals who don't have the same technical background - Strong teamwork and leadership skills - Strong algorithm design, logical and reasoning skills - Problem solving and decision-making skills - Proactive, flexible and resulted-oriented approach - Hands-on attitude
Syngenta is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate in recruitment, hiring, training, promotion or any other employment practices for reasons of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, marital or veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected status.

job.title: Civil Engineering Design Office Technician (SMB-SE-TOD-2020-85-LD)

company.name: CERN European Organization for Nuclear Research

job.plaincontent:
Company Description
At CERN, the European Organization for Nuclear Research, physicists and engineers are probing the fundamental structure of the universe. Using the world's largest and most complex scientific instruments, they study the basic constituents of matter - fundamental particles that are made to collide together at close to the speed of light. The process gives physicists clues about how particles interact, and provides insights into the fundamental laws of nature. Find out more on http://home.cern.
Job Description
Introduction
Are you an experienced civil engineering technician familiar with technical specifications and preliminary design studies? Would you like to be closely involved in a wide variety of projects? Join CERN's Site Engineering Group and put your skills to good use in a unique work context. Take part!
Functions
You will:
- Estimate costs for small- to large -scale work - Draw up standard documents for price enquiries and invitations to tender - Prepare feasibility studies (economic and environmental impact, etc.) - Produce cost estimates for large-scale (or future) projects and check quantities - Update and manage the catalogue of reference unit prices, including for framework contracts - Manage CERN's archive of technical specifications
Qualifications
Higher technical diploma in the field of civil engineering or equivalent relevant experience or a related field.
Experience:
- Significant experience in the design office of a civil engineering, architectural or construction firm. - Excellent technical knowledge and practice of various civil engineering and architectural fields (knowledge of construction materials and techniques). - Good experience in drawing up construction files and estimating costs. - Regular practice of price estimates for the construction and renovation of buildings and for outdoor work. - Knowledge and frequent practice of technical standards for construction work and structural design. Knowledge of Swiss and/or French regulations would be an advantage. - Proven experience in the coordination of HVAC-EL services (Heating, Ventilation, Air Cooling and Electricity) in design building.
Technical competencies:
- Knowledge of building construction, consolidation and renovation for industrial and tertiary buildings, involving concrete, metallic, underground structure construction and road and drainage works construction. - Design of industrial buildings: and tertiary buildings - Knowledge of construction/civil engineering prices - Design of road, excavation and drainage works - Budgeting, forecasting, statistics
Behavioural competencies:
- Achieving Results: being rigorous and producing quality results at first attempt - Managing Self: working well autonomously; taking on activities and tasks without prompting - Working in Teams: building and maintaining constructive and effective work relationships - Solving Problems: producing workable and timely solutions that meet requirements
Language skills:
Spoken and written English or French: ability to understand and speak the other language or the undertaking to acquire it rapidly.
Additional Information
Eligibility and closing date:
Diversity has been an integral part of CERN's mission since its foundation and is an established value of the Organization. Employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We welcome applications from all Member States and Associate Member States.
This vacancy will be filled as soon as possible, and applications should normally reach us no later than 26.07.2020
Employment Conditions
Contract type: Limited duration contract (5 years). Subject to certain conditions, holders of limited-duration contracts may apply for an indefinite position.
These functions require:
- Work in Radiation Areas. - Interventions in underground installations. - A valid driving licence is required.
Job grade: 3-4
Job reference: SMB-SE-TOD-2020-85-LD
Benchmark Job Title: Civil Engineering Technician

job.title: Legal Assistant (DG-LS-2019-127-LD)

company.name: CERN European Organization for Nuclear Research

job.plaincontent:
Company Description
At CERN, the European Organization for Nuclear Research, physicists and engineers are probing the fundamental structure of the universe. Using the world's largest and most complex scientific instruments, they study the basic constituents of matter - fundamental particles that are made to collide together at close to the speed of light. The process gives physicists clues about how particles interact, and provides insights into the fundamental laws of nature. Find out more on http://home.cern.
Job Description
Introduction
Do you have proven first class administrative support skills? Are you a service-oriented professional who enjoys being part of a dynamic team? Are you experienced in working in a fast-paced environment, managing a wide variety of confidential matters with accuracy and discretion? CERN, take part!
As part of the Director-General Unit, the Legal Service protects the interests of the Organization in legal matters and ensures that its activities and decisions comply with the applicable legal framework.
Functions
As a Legal Assistant in the Legal Service, you will perform duties under the supervision of the Head of Service. In particular, working closely with your colleague in the Legal Service secretariat, you will:
- Provide personal assistance and administrative support to senior lawyers; - Answer and/or direct queries and handle sensitive information appropriately; - Ensure written communications from the Legal Service meet an appropriate standard; - Prepare, compile, and/or perform final formatting and editing on files, documents and litigation briefs; - Optimise the efficiency of the Legal Service processes; - Maintain the Legal Service records; - Follow up on CERN’s scientific agreements and manage the applicable database; - Provide ad hoc administrative support as required for various internal CERN bodies.
Qualifications
Higher administrative diploma or equivalent relevant experience in the field of administration or a related field.
Experience
- Demonstrated experience as an administrative or editorial assistant in an international or multilingual environment. - Experience as a legal assistant or paralegal, or in providing ad hoc translations, would be an advantage.
Technical competencies:
- Preparation and finalisation of an array of documents such as litigation files. - Text editing and proof-reading. - Secretarial work. - Use of office software packages: experience with electronics document. management systems.
Behavioural competencies:
- Working in teams: building and maintaining constructive and effective work relationships. - Demonstrating flexibility: adapting quickly and resourcefully to shifting priorities and requirements. - Achieving results: delivering high quality work on time and fulfilling expectations. - Communicating effectively: ensuring that information, procedures and decisions are appropriately documented. - Managing self: working well autonomously; taking on activities and tasks without prompting.
Language skills:
- Spoken and written English and French: ability to understand and speak both languages in professional contexts as well as the ability to prepare and draft accurate texts in both languages.
Additional Information
Eligibility and closing date:
Diversity has been an integral part of CERN's mission since its foundation and is an established value of the Organization. Employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We welcome applications from all Member States and Associate Member States.
This vacancy will be filled as soon as possible, and applications should normally reach us no later than 26.07.2020.
The preferred start date would be in October 2020, depending on the evolution of the pandemic.
Employment Conditions
Contract type: Limited duration contract (5 years). Subject to certain conditions, holders of limited-duration contracts may apply for an indefinite position.
Job grade: 3-4
Job reference: DG-LS-2019-127-LD
Benchmark Job Title: Personal/Team Assistant

At CERN, the European Organization for Nuclear Research, physicists and engineers are probing the fundamental structure of the universe. Using the world's largest and most complex scientific instruments, they study the basic constituents of matter - fundamental particles that are made to collide together at close to the speed of light. The process gives physicists clues about how particles interact, and provides insights into the fundamental laws of nature. Find out more on http://home.cern.

Job Description

Introduction

Do you have proven first class administrative support skills? Are you a service-oriented professional who enjoys being part of a dynamic team? Are you experienced in working in a fast-paced environment, managing a wide variety of confidential matters with accuracy and discretion? CERN, take part!

As part of the Director-General Unit, the Legal Service protects the interests of the Organization in legal matters and ensures that its activities and decisions comply with the applicable legal framework.

Functions

As a Legal Assistant in the Legal Service, you will perform duties under the supervision of the Head of Service. In particular, working closely with your colleague in the Legal Service secretariat, you will:

  • Provide personal assistance and administrative support to senior lawyers;
  • Answer and/or direct queries and handle sensitive information appropriately;
  • Ensure written communications from the Legal Service meet an appropriate standard;
  • Prepare, compile, and/or perform final formatting and editing on files, documents and litigation briefs;
  • Optimise the efficiency of the Legal Service processes;
  • Maintain the Legal Service records;
  • Follow up on CERN’s scientific agreements and manage the applicable database;
  • Provide ad hoc administrative support as required for various internal CERN bodies.

Qualifications

Higher administrative diploma or equivalent relevant experience in the field of administration or a related field.

Experience

  • Demonstrated experience as an administrative or editorial assistant in an international or multilingual environment.
  • Experience as a legal assistant or paralegal, or in providing ad hoc translations, would be an advantage.

Technical competencies:

  • Preparation and finalisation of an array of documents such as litigation files.
  • Text editing and proof-reading.
  • Secretarial work.
  • Use of office software packages: experience with electronics document. management systems.

Behavioural competencies:

  • Working in teams: building and maintaining constructive and effective work relationships.
  • Demonstrating flexibility: adapting quickly and resourcefully to shifting priorities and requirements.
  • Achieving results: delivering high quality work on time and fulfilling expectations.
  • Communicating effectively: ensuring that information, procedures and decisions are appropriately documented.
  • Managing self: working well autonomously; taking on activities and tasks without prompting.

Language skills:

  • Spoken and written English and French: ability to understand and speak both languages in professional contexts as well as the ability to prepare and draft accurate texts in both languages.

Additional Information

Eligibility and closing date:

Diversity has been an integral part of CERN's mission since its foundation and is an established value of the Organization. Employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We welcome applications from all Member States and Associate Member States.

This vacancy will be filled as soon as possible, and applications should normally reach us no later than 26.07.2020.

The preferred start date would be in October 2020, depending on the evolution of the pandemic.

Employment Conditions

Contract type: Limited duration contract (5 years). Subject to certain conditions, holders of limited-duration contracts may apply for an indefinite position.

Job grade: 3-4

Job reference: DG-LS-2019-127-LD

Benchmark Job Title: Personal/Team Assistant

 

I'm interestedPrivacy Policy

job.title: Relationship Manager Frankreich (w/m)
job.plaincontent:
Relationship Manager Frankreich (w/m)
Die LGT ist die weltweit grösste Private Banking und Asset Management Gruppe im Besitz einer Unternehmerfamilie. Als Family Office des Fürstenhauses von Liechtenstein überzeugen wir Sie mit langjähriger Erfahrung in der Verwaltung grosser Vermögen.
Stellenbeschreibung
Für unsere langfristige Weiterentwicklung am Standort Vaduz sind wir im internationalen Private Banking auf der Suche nach einem kompetenten und begeisterungsfähigen Relationship Manager (w/m) für die Betreuung vermögender internationaler Klientel mit Sitz in Frankreich. Zu Ihren Aufgaben gehören insbesondere:
- Aufbau Ihres Portefeuilles durch Akquisition von vermögenden französischen Privatkunden (HNWI/UHNWI) auf der Basis Ihres bestehenden Netzwerks; - Pflege und gezielter kontinuierlicher Ausbau Ihres Portefeuilles basierend auf einem gepflegten Beziehungsmanagement und gelebter Servicekultur; - Situative Übernahme von bestehenden Kundenpositionen aus der Marktregion Frankreich; - Umfassende und professionelle Betreuung Ihrer anspruchsvollen Kunden; - Persönliche und ganzheitliche Beratung zusammen mit unseren Fachspezialisten aus dem Portfolio Management und dem Investment Advisory.
Unsere Anforderungen
Für diese verantwortungsvolle Position wenden wir uns an eine vertrauenswürdige und initiative Person mit folgendem Profil:
- Mehrjähriger erfolgreicher Leistungsausweis in der Akquisition, Beratung und Betreuung von vermögenden Privatkunden in den Bereichen Anlage- und Vermögensverwaltung; - Abgeschlossene Bankausbildung und/oder eine höhere Aus- oder Weiterbildung (z.B. Uni, FH, AZEK, CFA); - Dienstleistungsorientierte Persönlichkeit mit einer ausgeprägten Kundenorientierung; - Verantwortungsbewusstsein, gewinnendes Auftreten und hohe Eigeninitiative; - Gute Verankerung und Netzwerk bei vermögenden Familien und Privatkunden mit Steuerdomizil Frankreich; - Hohe Sozial-, Kommunikations- und Beratungskompetenzen; - Sehr gute Französisch- und Englischkenntnisse sowei gute Deutschkenntnisse.
Kontaktinformationen
Wir freuen uns auf Ihre Online Bewerbung. Für weitere Auskünfte stehen wir gerne zur Verfügung.
Michael Schiefner LGT Bank AG Human Resources
Kontakt
Bitte bewerben Sie sich über unser Online-Formular.

job.title: Doktoratsstelle - Einsatz von Künstlicher Intelligenz in Keramikbearbeitung 100%, Zürich, befristet
job.plaincontent:
Doktoratsstelle - Einsatz von Künstlicher Intelligenz in Keramikbearbeitung
100%, Zürich, befristet
Das Institut für Werkzeugmaschinen und Fertigung (IWF) der ETH Zürich betreibt grundlagen- und anwendungsorientierte Forschung in vielen Gebieten der Produktionstechnik. Es pflegt eine enge Kooperation mit der inspire AG, dem führenden Schweizer Kompetenzzentrum für den Technologietransfer zur Maschinen-, Elektro- und Metallindustrie. Geleitet von Prof. Dr. Konrad Wegener erstrecken sich die Arbeitsgebiete von Produktionsmaschinen über Fertigungsprozesse und Maschinensimulation bis hin zur virtuellen Realität. Zum Ausbau unserer Forschungsgruppe „Zerspanende Mikrobearbeitung“ bieten wir für junge Wissenschaftler (m/w) folgende Stelle.
Stellenbeschreibung
Das Hauptziel Ihrer Arbeit ist die Erforschung von Zerspanungsprozessen an unterschiedlichsten Hochleistungswerkstoffen mit ausserordentlichen Eigenschaften, die an die Bearbeitung extreme Herausforderungen stellen. Die Arbeit findet im Rahmen mehrjähriger Forschungsprojekte statt und beinhaltet den Entwurf von Zerspanstrategien, Prozess- und Werkzeuggestaltung, die Durchführung von Messkampagnen sowie Materialcharakterisierungsmethoden.
Mittels Einsatz leistungsfähiger Mess- & Analysetechnik, Prozessmodellierung, moderner Fünfachsfräsmaschinen und höchstdrehender Spindeln soll die Prozessfähigkeit der anvisierten Mikrobearbeitungsprozesse analysiert und erhöht werden. Ihre Aufgaben erfüllen Sie in enger Zusammenarbeit mit anderen Forschungsgruppen des IWF. Ein physikalisches Prozessmodell soll entwickelt werden. Der Vorteil vom Einsatz der künstlichen Intelligenz (KI), die das physikalische Modell und die experimentellen Ergebnisse / Messdaten kombiniert, soll genutzt werden. Es soll die Ermittlung der optimalen Prozessparameter für die Keramik-Zerspanung ermöglichen.
Ihr Profil
Sie erfüllen die Anforderungen für ein Doktoratsstudium an der ETH Zürich und können einen Master- oder Diplomabschluss im Bereich Maschinenbau oder Werkstofftechnik vorweisen. Erfahrungen in der Zerspanung, vorteilhaft in der Mikrobearbeitung, und Fertigungstechnik sind von Vorteil. Sie besitzen eine hohe Motivation und Wissbegierde. Zudem kombinieren Sie gerne theoretische Überlegungen und Modelle mit experimentellen Aufgabenstellungen, besitzen handwerkliches Geschick und möchten sich auch in der Lehre am IWF engagieren. Eine sehr gute mündliche sowie schriftliche Ausdrucksweise in Deutsch ist Bedingung und Ihre guten Englischkenntnisse runden Ihr Profil ab. Wir bieten Ihnen ab sofort eine Vollzeitstelle für die Dauer des Doktoratsstudiums. Durch die enge Zusammenarbeit mit unseren Projektpartnern knüpfen Sie schnell Kontakte zur Schweizerischen Industrie, und in unserem jungen, multidisziplinären Team arbeiten Sie an der Spitze des heutigen Wissens in der Zerspanung.
ETH Zürich
Die ETH Zürich ist eine der besten technisch-naturwissenschaftlichen Hochschulen der Welt. Wir sind bekannt für unsere exzellente Lehre, wegweisende Grundlagenforschung und den direkten Transfer von neuen Erkenntnissen in die Gesellschaft. Über 30'000 Menschen aus mehr als 120 Ländern finden bei uns ein Umfeld, das eigenständiges Denken fördert, und ein Klima, das zu Spitzenleistungen inspiriert. Im Herzen Europas und weltweit vernetzt entwickeln wir gemeinsam Lösungen für die globalen Herausforderungen von heute und morgen.Arbeiten, Lehren und Forschen an der ETH Zürich

job.title: Senior Financial Accountant (m/w/d)
job.plaincontent:
Aufgabenbereich:
- Sicherstellung der ordnungsgemässen Buchführung der Feldschlösschen Gesellschaften nach OR und IFRS - Stellvertretung des Head of Financial Accounting - Verantwortung von korrekten und vollständigen Monats-, Quartals- und Jahresabschlüssen - Verantwortung und vollumfängliche Bearbeitung der Aufgabengebiete MWST, Excise Duty, Tax, Recycling Fee - Koordination, Kontrolle und Überwachung der Shared Service Center im Tagesgeschäft - Weiterentwicklung und Optimierung von Prozessen - Sicherstellung aller Compliance Aufgaben in den operativen Prozessen (z.B. IKS, Datenschutz, Policy Compliance) - Enge Zusammenarbeit sowohl bereichsübergreifend wie auch mit dem Konzern, mit externen Revisoren und Behörden - Mitwirkung bei lokalen oder globalen Projekten
Anforderungen:
- Weiterbildung im Finanz- und Rechnungswesen, mindestens auf Niveau Fachausweis - Kommunikative, sozialkompetente Persönlichkeit mit Spass an gut vernetzter bereichsübergreifender Zusammenarbeit - Schnelle Auffassungsgabe, analytische und strategische Denkweise - Hohe Selbständigkeit, Arbeitsorganisation und Lösungsorientierung - Adressatengerechte Kommunikationsfähigkeit - Sehr gute Kenntnisse in Englisch und von Vorteil in Französisch - Systemkenntnisse: SAP, Excel
Ihre Vorteile
Wir freuen uns auf Ihre Online Bewerbung
Jetzt bewerben
Kontakt
Christian Hoffmann, Talent Acquisition & Employer Branding Manager
Wir brauen für ein besseres Heute und Morgen. Dabei lassen wir uns von unseren Leitmotiven "Pionier, Meister, Partner" motivieren und prägen aktiv die Schweizer Bierkultur. Als schönste Brauerei und Bierexperte des Landes produzieren wir ein einzigartiges, erfrischendes Naturprodukt und beliefern tagtäglich die Gastronomie und den Detailhandel.Feldschlösschen ist der führende und innovativste Getränkepartner der Schweiz. Unser Unternehmen mit Hauptsitz in Rheinfelden ist Teil der weltweit tätigen Carlsberg-Gruppe. Seit 1876 steht Feldschlösschen für Tradition und Innovation. Unsere Produkte bürgen für Qualität, Genuss und Lebensfreude. Rund 1'200 Mitarbeitende sind in zwei Brauereien in Rheinfelden und Sion tätig sowie am Standort der Mineralquelle Rhäzüns und an 15 Logistikstandorten in allen Landesteilen.

job.title: Computing Fellowship IT Contact and Virtual Machines Operator in CMS

company.name: CERN European Organization for Nuclear Research

job.plaincontent:
Company Description
At CERN, the European Organization for Nuclear Research, physicists and engineers are probing the fundamental structure of the universe. Using the world's largest and most complex scientific instruments, they study the basic constituents of matter - fundamental particles that are made to collide together at close to the speed of light. The process gives physicists clues about how particles interact, and provides insights into the fundamental laws of nature. Find out more on http://home.cern.
Diversity has been an integral part of CERN's mission since its foundation and is an established value of the Organization.
Job Description
Within the Programme, we are looking for a Scientist or Software Engineer to join CERN.
CERN is the host laboratory of the CMS experiment and many of the critical computing services reside in the computing centers of the laboratory. To support the central operations of the experiment, we are looking for a scientist/engineer to be the contact between CMS and the CERN IT department, who administers the virtual machine infrastructure used by the central services of the experiment, and provides backup support for the management of the CERN Virtual Machine File System, CVMFS, content of CMS.
The successful applicant is expected to administer all computing resources requested by CMS and provided by CERN IT, to organize the provisioning of new computing and storage resources, and to maintain the base OS configuration on these machines. The machines are of paramount importance as they host critical services vital to the operation of the computing infrastructure of the experiment. The successful applicant is expected to maintain excellent relations with the CERN-IT staff, attend regular meetings and follow up on all coordination issues.
At CERN, CMS uses large disk and tape storage as well as compute resources provisioned through a private Openstack based cloud infrastructure. The successful candidate will administer such resources, a task that requires a high level of responsibility, excellent organizational and communication skills, and willingness to assist and help colleagues.
You will take part in all aspects of the devops process, specifically:
- Administer all computing resources requested by CMS and provided by CERN IT; - Cultivate relations with the CERN IT professionals, also attending regular meetings and follow up on all coordination issues; - Maintain quotas for users and groups on common CMS storage at CERN and coordinate these with computing management, as well as detector and physics groups; - Curate an inventory of machines and document their configuration needs; - Develop new and enhance existing tools for automation of tasks otherwise requiring manual interventions; - Provide assistance and consultation on setup and configuration to users and groups less familiar with Linux system administration.
Qualifications
Eligibility criteria:
- You are a national of a CERN Member or Associate Member State; - You have graduated, or are about to graduate with a university degree (BSc or MSc level in computer science,engineering or another relevant course) and have no more than 4 years’ relevant experience after obtaining your degree; - Kindly note that experience prior to the latest obtained degree will not be taken into account for the calculation of your overall years of experience.
Essential skills and experience:
- Experience with Linux system administration and service configuration; - Knowledge of shell scripting; - Knowledge of system administrator tools e.g. Puppet; - Team spirit; - Fluent in English and excellent communication skills.
Other desired skills:
- Experience in Cloud systems, Openstack in particular; - Initial experience in ticketing systems and computing service support; - Knowledge of batch and storage systems, e.g. tape, disk.
Please note that CERN Staff members are not eligible to apply for a Fellowship.
Additional Information
CERN would very much like to benefit from your expertise, commitment and passion.
In return, CERN will provide you with:
- An employment contract for between six months (minimum) up to a maximum of 36 months. - A stipend ranging from 5,281 to 6,558 Swiss Francs per month (net of tax). - Coverage by CERN’s comprehensive health scheme (for yourself, your spouse and children), and membership of the CERN Pension Fund. - Depending on your individual circumstances: an installation grant, family, child and infant allowances as well as travel expenses to and from Geneva. - 2.5 days of paid leave per month.
Your Life @CERN
Find out more here: https://hr-dep.web.cern.ch/content/life-cern
This is how you can apply:
You will need the following documents to complete your application:
- A CV. - A scanned PDF of your most recent relevant qualification.
We recommend to add two recent letters of recommendation, giving an overview of your academic and/or professional achievements. You can upload these letters at the time of application if you have them to hand. You will also be provided with a link as soon as you have submitted your application to forward to your referees to upload their letters confidentially. Please note this must be done before the closing date.
All applications should reach us no later than 2 August 2020.
I'm interestedPrivacy Policy

Company Description

At CERN, the European Organization for Nuclear Research, physicists and engineers are probing the fundamental structure of the universe. Using the world's largest and most complex scientific instruments, they study the basic constituents of matter - fundamental particles that are made to collide together at close to the speed of light.   • Cultivate relations with the CERN IT professionals, also attending regular meetings and follow up on all coordination issues;
  • Maintain quotas for users and groups on common CMS storage at CERN and coordinate these with computing management, as well as detector and physics groups;
  • Curate an inventory of machines and document their configuration needs;
  • Develop new and enhance existing tools for automation of tasks otherwise requiring manual interventions;
  • Provide assistance and consultation on setup and configuration to users and groups less familiar with Linux system administration.

Qualifications

Eligibility criteria:

  • You are a national of a CERN Member or Associate Member State;
  • You have graduated, or are about to graduate with a university degree (BSc or MSc level in computer science,engineering or another relevant course) and have no more than 4 years’ relevant experience after obtaining your degree;
  • Kindly note that experience prior to the latest obtained degree will not be taken into account for the calculation of your overall years of experience.

Essential skills and experience:

  • Experience with Linux system administration and service configuration;
  • Knowledge of shell scripting;
  • Knowledge of system administrator tools e.g. Puppet;
  • Team spirit;
  • Fluent in English and excellent communication skills.

Other desired skills:

  • Experience in Cloud systems, Openstack in particular;
  • Initial experience in ticketing systems and computing service support;
  • Knowledge of batch and storage systems, e.g. tape, disk.

Please note that CERN Staff members are not eligible to apply for a Fellowship.

Additional Information

CERN would very much like to benefit from your expertise, commitment and passion.  

In return, CERN will provide you with:

  • An employment contract for between six months (minimum) up to a maximum of 36 months.
  • A stipend ranging from 5,281 to 6,558 Swiss Francs per month (net of tax).
  • Coverage by CERN’s comprehensive health scheme (for yourself, your spouse and children), and membership of the CERN Pension Fund.
  • Depending on your individual circumstances: an installation grant, family, child and infant allowances as well as travel expenses to and from Geneva.
  • 2.5 days of paid leave per month.


Your Life @CERN

Find out more here: https://hr-dep.web.cern.ch/content/life-cern

This is how you can apply:

You will need the following documents to complete your application:

  • A CV.
  • A scanned PDF of your most recent relevant qualification.

We recommend to add two recent letters of recommendation, giving an overview of your academic and/or professional achievements. You can upload these letters at the time of application if you have them to hand. You will also be provided with a link as soon as you have submitted your application to forward to your referees to upload their letters confidentially. Please note this must be done before the closing date.

All applications should reach us no later than 2 August 2020.

 

I'm interestedPrivacy Policy

job.title: Mitarbeiter/in Customer Service mit Verkaufsaffinität 80%-100%
job.plaincontent:
Mitarbeiter/in Customer Service mit Verkaufsaffinität 80%-100%
Adliswil Zürich Reference No: WD-0000261
Wen suchen wir?
Sie suchen eine neue Herausforderung als Verkaufsinnendienstmitarbeiter/in? Sie verfügen über eine Persönlichkeit, die nicht nur beraten will, sondern gerne auch verkäuferisch aktiv sein möchte? Dann sind Sie bei uns richtig: Wir suchen Verstärkung für unser Kundendienstteam in Adliswil. Bei uns finden Sie allerdings keinen 0815 Job. Sie arbeiten mit Kolleginnen und Kollegen aus den unterschiedlichsten Erfahrungsbereichen zusammen, welche dieselben Interessen teilen: Eine aussergewöhnliche Bereitschaft, Neues zu lernen und zu teilen, eine Passion für innovative Lösungen und die Motivation, hervorragende Leistung zu zeigen.
Wer ist Hilti?
Wir entwickeln, fertigen und vertreiben hochmoderne Produkte, Technologien, Software und Dienstleistungen für die Bauindustrie. Wir können auf 75 Jahre Firmenerfahrung zurückblicken und unsere bahnbrechenden Produkte und unser außergewöhnlicher Service sind in der ganzen Welt bekannt. Hilti steht für Innovation, Qualität und direkte Kundenbeziehungen. Mit 30.000 Beschäftigten in über 120 Ländern bieten wir Ihnen ein beeindruckendes Umfeld, in dem Sie sich beweisen, wachsen und Ihre Karriere selbst gestalten können.
Was sind Ihre Aufgaben?
Als Mitarbeiter/in im Kundenservice sind Sie das Aushängeschild unserer renommierten Marke. Wir bieten ein Premiumprodukt, von dem unsere Kunden einen entsprechend hohen Service erwarten. Bei jedem Kundenanliegen sind Sie ein kompetenter Ansprechpartner und sorgen stets für einen freundlichen und persönlichen telefonischen Kontakt. Sie beraten unsere Kunden und Außendienstmitarbeitenden telefonisch hinsichtlich Produkte-, Service- und anwendungstechnischen Fragen, nehmen Bestellungen entgegen, erstellen Offerten und bearbeiten Reklamationen. Sie zeigen Lösungsvorschläge bei technischen Anfragen auf und agieren als Koordinationsstelle zwischen den verschiedenen Verkaufskanälen und unseren internen Abteilungen. Des Weiteren denken Sie unternehmerisch und erkennen Chancen, Zusatzverkäufe zu tätigen. Sie verfolgen wie ein/e echter Verkäufer/in nicht nur das Ziel einer qualitativ hochstehenden Beratung, sondern auch das eines nachhaltigen Wachstums und Verkaufserfolgs.
93 % unserer Mitarbeiter sagen, dass sie stolz sind für Hilti zu arbeiten und nennen als Grund dafür die Qualität unserer Produkte und der Art, wie wir mit unseren Mitarbeitern umgehen.
Was bieten wir?
Wir schaffen für Sie die Voraussetzungen, um hervorragende Arbeit leisten zu können. Dazu gehören ein umfangreiches Training, professionelle Arbeitsmittel und ein freundliches und unterstützendes Arbeitsumfeld. Neben einer attraktiven Entlohnung, guten Sozialleistungen und einer geregelten Arbeitszeit (Öffnungszeiten Kundendienst: Mo-Fr 07.00–17:30 Uhr) erwartet Sie außerdem eine einzigartige Unternehmenskultur, die es Ihnen ermöglicht, Ihre Ideen einzubringen.
Warum suchen wir gerade Sie?
Bei uns arbeiten hochqualifizierte Menschen, die aus den verschiedensten Bereichen kommen. Einige unserer besten Kundendienstmitarbeitenden haben noch nie im Kundendienst gearbeitet. Erfolg basiert bei Hilti immer auf Teamarbeit und Kompetenz - egal, welchen Werdegang der Einzelne mitbringt.
Was Sie mitbringen:
- Freude am intensiven telefonischen Kundenkontakt (bis zu 100 Kontaktpunkte pro Tag) - Ausgeprägte Kommunikationsfähigkeiten sowie hoher Kundenfokus - Rasche Auffassungsgabe, Flexibilität, Belastbarkeit und Teamfähigkeit - Idealerweise Erfahrung in einer ähnlichen Funktion (Customer Service) - Sehr gute Deutsch- und Französischkenntnisse; Italienischkenntnisse von Vorteil - Hohe verkäuferische Affinität und Wunsch, proaktiv auf den Kunden zuzugehen, um nebst einer qualitativ hochstehenden Beratung einen Verkaufserfolg zu ermöglichen - Abgeschlossene Berufslehre; jede Weiterbildung (z.B. TK oder Fachhochschule) ist von Vorteil - Erfahrung auf dem Bau ist von Vorteil, noch wichtiger sind uns aber Ihre Lernbegeisterung und Ihr absoluter Wille, einen erstklassigen Kundenservice anzubieten.
Haben wir Ihr Interesse geweckt, bei einem der besten Arbeitgeber der Schweiz zu arbeiten? Dann freuen wir uns auf Ihre aussagekräftige Bewerbung. Bitte reichen Sie Ihre vollständigen Bewerbungsunterlagen (Motivationsschreiben, CV, Zeugnisse) ausschliesslich über unser Online-Karrieretool auf www.careers.hilti.ch ein.
«Bei Hilti kann man Verantwortung übernehmen. Hilti ist ehrlich, bodenständig, knackig und erfrischend»
- Urs, Geschäftsführer Hilti Schweiz

Was Sie mitbringen:

  • Freude am intensiven telefonischen Kundenkontakt (bis zu 100 Kontaktpunkte pro Tag)
  • Ausgeprägte Kommunikationsfähigkeiten sowie hoher Kundenfokus
  • Rasche Auffassungsgabe, Flexibilität, Belastbarkeit und Teamfähigkeit
  • Idealerweise Erfahrung in einer ähnlichen Funktion (Customer Service)
  • Sehr gute Deutsch- und Französischkenntnisse; Italienischkenntnisse von Vorteil
  • Hohe verkäuferische Affinität und Wunsch, proaktiv auf den Kunden zuzugehen, um nebst einer qualitativ hochstehenden Beratung einen Verkaufserfolg zu ermöglichen

job.title: Disponent/in, Arztsekretär/in Fusschirurgie 80% - 100%
job.plaincontent:
Die Schulthess Klinik in Zürich ist eine der führenden orthopädischen Kliniken Europas mit über 1‘000 Mitarbeitenden. Unser zentrales Anliegen ist es, Menschen von ihren Schmerzen zu befreien und ihre Mobilität wiederherzustellen. Als Spezialklinik konzentrieren wir uns auf chirurgische Orthopädie, Neurologie, Rheumatologie und Sportmedizin. Die Schulthess Klinik ist Swiss Olympic Medical Center.
Zur Ergänzung unserer Abteilung suchen wir eine/n motivierte/n und einsatzfreudige/n
Disponent/in, Arztsekretär/in Fusschirurgie 80% - 100%
Ihre Aufgaben
Sie organisieren und koordinieren die Sprechstunden, kümmern sich um deren Vorbereitung und heissen unsere Patienten am Empfang willkommen. Sie bestellen fehlende Röntgenbilder und Akten der aufzubietenden Patienten, schreiben Konsultations-, Austritt-, Operations- und Versicherungsberichte ab Diktaphon und erfassen die Daten im System. Das Erledigen der eingehenden Post und der telefonischen Anfragen gehören ebenfalls zu Ihrem Aufgabenbereich. Dabei arbeiten Sie eng mit dem Ärzteteam zusammen und sind Ansprechpartner/in für ihre Patienten. Gegenseitige Ferien- und Krankheitsvertretung im Sekretariatsteam ist selbstverständlich.
Ihr Profil
•Ausbildung als MPA und/oder Zusatzausbildung als Spital- und Arztsekretär/in mit langjähriger Berufserfahrung in einer ergleichbaren Position •Freude am Schreiben und sichere Anwendung der medizinischen Terminologie •Grosses Interesse an der Chirurgie im Bereich Orthopädie •Dienstleistungsorientiert und Freude am direkten Patientenkontakt •Vertrauensvolle, selbständige, belastbare und kommunikative Persönlichkeit •Flexible und teamorientierte Arbeitsweise •Sehr gute und stilsichere Deutschkenntnisse, Kenntnisse in Englisch, Französisch, Italienisch wünschenswert
Wir bieten
eine verantwortungsvolle und abwechslungsreiche Tätigkeit in einem motivierten Team, gute Einführung sowie zeitgemässe Anstellungsbedingungen. Mit Ihrem Engagement tragen Sie zum nachhaltigen Erfolg der Klinik bei. Es erwartet Sie ein moderner Arbeitsplatz in einem dynamischen Arbeitsumfeld.
Wenn Sie mehr über diese Stelle erfahren möchten, gibt Ihnen Frau Naemi Vögeli, Praxismanagerin Fusschirurgie, Tel. +41 (0)44 385 78 15, gerne weitere Auskünfte.
Haben wir Ihr Interesse geweckt? Dann freuen wir uns auf Ihre Online Bewerbung - Papierbewerbungen werden nicht zurück geschickt.
Haben wir Ihr Interesse geweckt? Dann freuen wir uns auf Ihre (Online-)Bewerbung
Online Bewerbung
Lengghalde 2, CH-8008 Zürich, Tel. +41 44 385 71 71, www.schulthess-klinik.ch
